text: Andrés Flores was one of four important criollo composers in baroque Bolivia trained by Juan de Araujo, during his tenure as choirmaster of the Cathedral of Sucre (then called La Plata) 1680-1712.Tess Knighton, Álvaro Torrente. Devotional music in the Iberian world, 1450-1800p416 The other three notable criollo composers were Sebastián de los Ríos, Roque Jacinto de Chavarría, and Blas Tardío y Guzmán. ==Works== * juguete Peregrina Agraciada DiosRobert Murrell Stevenson Renaissance and baroque musical sources in the Americas 1970 Page 241 * A este edificio célebreRecording on Le Phénix du Mexique - Villancicos de Sor Juana Inès de la Cruz. Garrido K617 * motet Tota pulchra es, Maria and villancico Ay del alma mía!Recording on Festa Criolla Ensemble Elyma and Ars Longa of Havana, dir. Gabriel Garrido. K617 2005. * VillancicoRecording on Musique Baroque á la Royale Audience de Charcas. ==References== Category:Bolivian composers Category:Bolivian male musicians Category:Male composers Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing
title: Andrés Flores (composer)
